1638.96.text: You were unlucky with how the questions fell, I think.

1641.28.text: Thank you very much for joining us, and to go out in the final,

1643.84.text: well, there's only one way you could go out better than, so congratulations to you.

1647.56.text: And many congratulations to you too, Gonville and Caius.

1650.24.text: I hope you'll be happy to receive the trophy.

1657.36.text: Now to present the trophy is one of the country's leading writers.

1660.36.text: He's a prize-winning novelist, a prolific journalist,

1662.76.text: a regular broadcaster on television and radio, and he's also

1665.60.text: Professor of Contemporary Thought at Brunel University.

1682.40.text: So, you got them all, of course.

1685.64.text:
- I got about, er... Should we be honest? 
- Yes.

1689.64.text:
- I would think about 35%, actually. 
- That's jolly good.

1692.56.text: And I'll tell you something, when you tune in at home, you tend to think...

1697.44.text: You don't take account of the mental agility involved.

1700.56.text: Something about being in the gallery, and I don't know

1702.88.text: if that went for the live audience as well, makes you very aware

1706.24.text: of not simply the retention of information involved,

1709.24.text: but the actual on-the-spot mental agility, as well.

1712.12.text: So I was enormously impressed. I've never been that smart.

1714.80.text:
- So what did you think? 
- I thought...

1717.56.text: I sympathised with my old alma mater, I confess.

1722.08.text:
- Which is your old alma mater? 
- It's Oxford.

1724.36.text: Though I felt the break of the questions

1727.48.text: perhaps didn't go in their favour, but I have to say

1730.56.text: that when I saw what the members of each team were reading,

1736.16.text: I did feel that Gonville and Caius had a better spread,

1739.92.text: that there was a more eclectic knowledge base there.

1742.68.text: And you can't really take it away from them.

1744.88.text:
- They did do extremely well. 
- They were brilliant. 
- Yeah.

1747.36.text: They were. Well, can I ask you now to present them

1749.52.text:
- with the trophy, please? 
- With great pleasure. Please. 
- Good.

1752.12.text:
- Come on, chaps. 
- Come and receive this handsome thing. APPLAUSE

1760.68.text:
- Is this the captain? 
- Yeah, this is the captain. 
- Here we go.

1763.92.text:
- Here it is. That's it. You've done it. 
- Thank you.

1777.40.text: So, that's it for this series.

1778.92.text: It starts all over again pretty shortly.

1781.08.text: Till then, it's goodbye from all of us. Goodbye.
